name: form_name
label: Form Name

name: form_version
label: Version

name: protocol_note
label: This form takes stand counts and asseses possible disease in corn. These observations will ideally be taken at V2 - V3.

name: protocol_note2
label: You will need a 10 ft measuring device, ~ 8 marking flags, and this kobo form to do stand counts and growth stages.

name: protocol_note3
label: If there is a 10% difference in stand count and growth stage between the cover and bare, the form promts you to dig samples. You will return to your marked sections with a shovel and a plastic bag for each treatment.

name: code
label: What is your 3 letter farm code?

name: date
label: Today's date

name: note_1
label: Begin by heading to your Rep 1 Cover Crop Strip

name: cover_rep1_1
label: Rep 1 Cover Crop Sample 1:

name: note_2
label: Find a row about 1/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a 10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep1_s1_cover_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep1_s1_cover_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep1_s1_cover_growthdifference
label: How many of your corn seedlings are at least one growth stage behind this?

name: note_next
label: Move on to Rep 1 Cover Crop Sample 2

name: cover_rep1_2
label: Rep 1 Cover Crop Sample 2:

name: note_2_001
label: Find a row about 3/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a 10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep1_s2_cover_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep1_s2_cover_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep1_s2_cover_growthdifference
label: How many of your corn seedlings are at least one growth stage behind this?

name: note_next1
label: Move on to Rep 1 Bare Sample 1

name: bare_rep1_1
label: Rep 1 Bare Sample 1:

name: note_2_002
label: Find a row about 1/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep1_s1_bare_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep1_s1_bare_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep1_s1_bare_growthdifference
label: How many of your corn seedlings are at least one growth stage behind this?

name: note_next2
label: Move on to Rep 1 Bare Sample 2

name: bare_rep1_2
label: Rep 1 Bare Sample 2:

name: note_2_003
label: Find a row about 3/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a 10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep1_s2_bare_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep1_s2_bare_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep1_s2_bare_growthdifference
label: How many of your corn seedlings are at least one growth stage behind this?

name: Rep_1_Corn_Seedling_Sampling
label: Rep 1 Corn Seedling Sampling

name: rep1_count_sample
label: Your rep 1 bare and cover strips have significant differences in stand count or growth stage. Return to all 4 sampling lengths in rep 1 and take seedling samples

name: sample_collection
label:
Using a hand trowel or shovel, carefully dig up five consecutive seedlings of corn 
from each sampling length. Take care to collect the entire seedling root system

name: root_cleaning
label: Loosen the soil from around the roots by gently shaking the seedlings, thereby preserving the seedling shoot and root system.

name: sample_transport
label: Place the seedlings into plastic bags labeled with the treatment (cover or bare) and the rep. Transport the seedling samples to the lab in a cooler with ice.

name: no_sample
label: Your rep 1 bare and cover strips do not have significant differences so you do not need to sample. Move on to rep 2

name: cover_rep2_1
label: Rep 2 Cover Crop Sample 1:

name: note_2_004
label: Find a row about 1/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a 10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep2_s1_cover_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep2_s1_cover_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep2_s1_cover_growthdifference
label: How many of your corn seedlings are at least one growth stage behind this?

name: next1
label: Move on to Rep 2 Cover Crop Sample 2

name: cover_rep2_2
label: Rep 2 Cover Crop Sample 2:

label: Find a row about 3/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a 10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep2_s2_cover_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep2_s2_cover_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep2_s2_cover_growthdifference
label: How many of your corn seedlings are at least one growth stage behind this?

name: next2
label: Move on to Rep 2 Bare Sample 1

name: bare_rep2_1
label: Rep 2 Bare Sample 1:

name: note_2_006
label: Find a row about 1/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a 10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep2_s1_bare_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep2_s1_bare_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep2_s1_bare_growthdifference

name: group5_001
label: Rep 2 Bare Sample 2:

name: note_2_007
label: Find a row about 3/4 of the way from the edge of the strip. Walk ~100 feet up the row. Measure out a 10 ft section of the row and mark the sampling length with flags on either end.

name: rep2_s2_bare_count
label: Number of corn seedlings:

name: rep2_s2_bare_averagegrowthstage
label: What is the most frequent growth stage of the seedlings in 10 ft

name: rep2_s2_bare_growthdifference
label: How many of your corn seedlings are at least one growth stage behind this?

name: Rep_2_Corn_Seedling_Sampling
label: Rep 2 Corn Seedling Sampling

name: rep2_count_sample
label: Your rep 2 bare and cover strips have significant differences in stand count or growth stage. Return to all 4 sampling lengths in rep 2 and take seedling samples

name: sample_collection_001
label:
Using a hand trowel or shovel, carefully dig up five consecutive seedlings of corn 
from each sampling length. Take care to collect the entire seedling root system

name: root_cleaning_001
label: Loosen the soil from around the roots by gently shaking the seedlings, thereby preserving the seedling shoot and root system.

name: sample_transport_001
label: Place the seedlings into plastic bags labeled with the treatment (cover or bare) and the rep. Transport the seedling samples to the lab in a cooler with ice.

name: no_sample_001
label: Your rep 2 bare and cover strips do not have significant differences so you do not need to sample

name: sample_storage
label: Back at the lab, place the seedlings in a fridge until you can wash and photograph them. Seedlings can be stored in a fridge for up to 48 hours. Do NOT wash seedlings and put them back into the fridge. Once washed, seedlings must be photographed.

name: note_end
label: If you have not seen any promts to dig, then you have finished with field sampling. If you have dug plants, save this form to take seedling photos in the lab.

name: comments_field
label: Do you have any comments about the field process of the protocol or notes about the field?

name: Seedling_Photos
label: Seedling Photos

name: photonote
label: Instructions and places to take photos will appear in this form here if any of your reps required images. If you were not prompted to dig plants, you can finish and submit the form.

name: seedling_wash
label: Carefully wash seedlings under running water to remove all soil and debris. Keep as much of the root system as possible. Once the roots are clean, blot the roots dry with a paper towel

name: seedling_image
label: Lay out the 10 seedlings from each bag onto a white background. Place a label with the treatment name and rep on the white background. Take photos of the roots of the seedling samples. Make sure the roots fill the view and that there is no glare

label: Rep 1 Cover Crop Image

label: Do you have any comments about the seedling photos or other comments?

name: group_lh6ba50
label: Root and Shoot Dry Weights

name: weightnote
label: Places to take dry weights will appear in this form here if any of your reps required sampling. Fill in any that are applicable and leave others blank.  If you were not prompted to dig plants, you can finish and submit the form.
